ACT
234
Subsequently found property
If, after the decision on inheritance becomes final, property is found that is not covered by that decision, the court will not conduct the probate hearing again, but will distribute this property with a new decision on the basis of the previously adopted decision on inheritance, unless one of the heirs has renounced the inheritance or his ceded the inheritance to a co-heir.
If the probate hearing was not conducted before, the court will ex officio conduct it only if immovable properties have been found or rights equalized with them.
If a probate hearing was not conducted before, and movable property was found or rights equalized with them, the court will conduct a probate hearing only at the request of interested persons.
